suile: <entryFree id="n46500" type="main" key="su^i_le"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭīle</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>sus</etym>, <sense id="n46500.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hog-sty</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:9:14" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 9, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suillates: <entryFree id="n46501" type="main" key="Su^illa_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sŭillātes</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n46501.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Umbria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 14, 19, § 114</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suillus: <entryFree id="n46502" type="main" key="su^illus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭillus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sus</etym>, <sense id="n46502.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to swine.</hi> </sense><sense id="n46502.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:4:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 4, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:9:14" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 9, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">grex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 52, 78, § 212</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rostrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 33, 51, § 121</bibl></cit>: caro, <hi rend="ital">swine</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s flesh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pork</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:4:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 4, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lac,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 8, 29, § 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fungi, an inferior kind of mushroom,</quote> <trans><tr>black hogmushrooms</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 23, 47, § 96</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:60:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 60, 5</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n46502.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭilla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. caro), <hi rend="ital">pork</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26:30" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 26, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 5, 12, § 38</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suinus: <entryFree id="n46503" type="main" key="su^i_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n46503.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to swine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swine-</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 594</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">caro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:4:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 4, 8</bibl></cit> (MSS.; <cit><quote lang="la">Gesn. and Schneid. suilla): sevum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 4, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suiones: <entryFree id="n46504" type="main" key="Sui^o^nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Suĭŏnes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n46504.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a northern Germanic people of Scandinavia</hi>, in the mod. <hi rend="ital">Sweden</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 44</bibl> and 45.</sense></entryFree>
suismontium: <entryFree id="n46505" type="main" key="Suismontium"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Suismontium</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n46505.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountain of Liguria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:41" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 41</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sulca: <entryFree id="n46506" type="main" key="Sulca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sulca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n46506.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Q. Baetius Sulca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sulcamen: <entryFree id="n46507" type="hapax" key="sulca_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sulcāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>sulco</etym>, <sense id="n46507.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a furrow</hi>, = sulcus, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 174, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sulcator: <entryFree id="n46508" type="main" key="sulca_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sulcātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n46508.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who draws furrows</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a furrower</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plougher</hi> (in postAug. poets). </sense><sense id="n46508.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Leontini campi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> adv. Symm. 2, 939</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patuli agri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Perieg. 587</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46508.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">one who sails over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">traverses</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">sulcator navita ponti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:363" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 363</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pigri Averni,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Charon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:588" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 588</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">undae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bagrada sulcator harenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:588" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 588</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46508.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A render</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tearer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lacerator</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lateris sulcator (vultur),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 2, 340</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sulcatorius: <entryFree id="n46509" type="main" key="sulca_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sulcātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n46509.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sailing over;</hi> only in <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sulcātōrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (late Lat.), <hi rend="ital">a ship</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a barge</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 2, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sulci: <entryFree id="n46510" type="main" key="Sulci"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sulci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n46510.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ancient maritime city on the southern coast of Sardinia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">founded by Carthage</hi>, now the ruins of <hi rend="ital">Palma de Solo</hi> near <hi rend="ital">Sulci</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:19" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 19</bibl>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n46510.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sulcensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <hi rend="ital">of Sulci</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">promuntorium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 7, 13, § 84</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 645</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46510.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sulcĭtāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Sulci</hi>, Auct. B. Afr. 98, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 7, 13, § 85</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sulco: <entryFree id="n46511" type="main" key="sulco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sulco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>sulcus</etym>, <sense id="n46511.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to furrow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cut furrows through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to plough</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; not in Cic. or Cæs.). </sense><sense id="n46511.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, in agriculture: <cit><quote lang="la">agros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:3:85" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 3, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(rura) sulcata Camilli Vomere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 168</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vomere humum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:10:68" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 10, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">campos vomere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:191" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 191</bibl></cit>. — <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">recto plenoque sulcare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:25" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 2, 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46511.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n46511.3" n="(a)" level="5"> Ingen., <hi rend="ital">to furrow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plough;</hi> <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to sail over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">traverse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pass through</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">sulcant fossas, quo pluvia aqua delabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:29:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 29, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(anguis) harenam Sulcat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:726" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 726</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter caudā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:721" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 721</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longā sulcant vada salsa carinā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 158</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rate undas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:10:33" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 10, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:707" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 4, 707</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">maria arbore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 1, 2, § 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regna volatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:668" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 668</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sulcavitque cutem rugis,</quote> <trans><tr>furrowed her skin with wrinkles</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:276" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 276</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gressus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 167, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sulcatis lateribus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>by lashes</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 9, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46511.4" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To elaborate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to work out</hi> (cf. exaro), Ven. Fort. Vita Mart.</sense></entryFree>
sulcus: <entryFree id="n46512" type="main" key="sulcus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sulcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, only ficus sulca, <sense id="n46512.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an unknown species of fig-tree</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:10:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 10, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n46513" type="main" key="sulcus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sulcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Gr. <foreign lang="greek">o(lko/s,</foreign> from <foreign lang="greek">e(/lkw</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n46513.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a furrow made by the plough</hi> (cf.: lira, porca): sulci appellantur, quā aratrum ducitur, vel sationis faciendae causā vel urbis condendae, vel fossura rectis lateribus, ubi arbores serantur: quod vocabulum quidam ex Graeco fictum, quia illi dicant <foreign lang="greek">o(lko/n,</foreign> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=302" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 302</bibl> Müll.: quā aratrum vomere lacunam striam facit, sulcus vocatur: quod est inter duos sulcos elata terra, dicitur <pb n="1797" /> <cb n="SULL" /> porca, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:29:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 29, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sulco vario ne ares,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 61, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum sulcus altius esset impressus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:23:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 23, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ducere ... infodere sulcum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:27" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 2, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:48" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">duci sarculo sulcum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:327" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 33, 76, § 327</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proscindere jugerum sulco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 19, 49, § 178</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sulco tenui arare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 18, 47, § 170</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sulcum patefacere aratro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sulcis committere semina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 223</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mandare hordea sulcis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 5, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">telluri infindere sulcos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semina longis Cerealia sulcis Obruere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herba Cerealibus obruta sulcis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:12:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 12, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46513.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n46513.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A ploughing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hordeum altero sulco seminari debet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:9:15" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 9, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quarto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:12:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 12, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quinto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 20, 49, § 181</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nono,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 6, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46513.3" n="B" level="2"> Of things resembling a furrow. </sense><sense id="n46513.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A long</hi>, <hi rend="ital">narrow trench</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a ditch</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 33, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">43, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:8:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 8, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 4, 20, § 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 289</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:425" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 425</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n46513.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A rut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">track</hi>, in gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">cursu rotarum saucia clarescunt nubila sulco, Claud. Cons. Prob. et Olymp. 102.—Esp., of the furrow cut by a vessel: infindunt sulcos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">delere sulcos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:415" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 415</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canebant aequora sulco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:32" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 32</bibl></cit>.—Of <hi rend="ital">a wrinkle</hi> of the skin, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:72:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 72, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">genarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Eutr. 1, 110</bibl></cit>.—Of <hi rend="ital">the trail</hi> of a meteor, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:697" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 697</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:562" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 562</bibl>.—Of wounds: <cit><quote lang="la">in pectore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Prov. 3, 425</bibl></cit>.—Of <hi rend="ital">the private parts</hi> of a woman, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1272" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1272</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 136</bibl>; App. <foreign lang="greek">*)anex.</foreign> 16.</sense></entryFree>
sulfur: <entryFree id="n46514" type="main" key="sulfur"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sulfur</orth> (in MSS. also <orth extent="full" lang="la">sulphur</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">sulpur</orth>), <itype>ŭris</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (<sense id="n46514.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">masc.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Prax. 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 1, 38 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>), <hi rend="ital">brimstone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sulphur.</hi> </sense><sense id="n46514.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 15, 50, § 174</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 39, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:5:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 5, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:13:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 13, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:739" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 739</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:221" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 221</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:748" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 748</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:807" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 807</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:5:11" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 5, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 8, 86; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:405" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 405</bibl> et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">viva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:449" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 449</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivacia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:374" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 374</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lurida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:791" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 791</bibl></cit>; 15, 351; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:76" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 76</bibl> Spald. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> used as a cement, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:48" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 48</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46514.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">lightning</hi> (so called from its sulphureous smell): <cit><quote lang="la">aethereum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:2:24" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 2, 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sulfurans: <entryFree id="n46515" type="hapax" key="sulfu^rans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sulfŭrans</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sulph-</orth>), <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sulfur; cf. sulfuratus</etym>, <sense id="n46515.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">containing sulphur</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sulphurous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sulfuraria: <entryFree id="n46516" type="main" key="sulfu^ra_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sulfŭrārĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sulph-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sulfur</etym>, <sense id="n46516.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sulphur pit</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in calcariam vel sulfurariam damnari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:19:8:section=10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 19, 8, § 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:2:53:section=10" default="NO">47, 2, 53, § 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sulfuratio: <entryFree id="n46517" type="hapax" key="sulfu^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sulfŭrātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sulph-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n46517.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a vein of sulphur</hi> in the earth, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:15:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 15, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sulfuratus: <entryFree id="n46518" type="main" key="sulfu^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sulfŭrātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sulph-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n46518.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">impregnated with sulphur</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sulphurated.</hi> </sense><sense id="n46518.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fontes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 6, 32, § 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ramentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:3:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">merx,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:57:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 57, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 5</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gehenna,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 1, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46518.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sul-fŭrāta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n46518.3" n="A" level="2"> (Sc. fila.) <hi rend="ital">Brimstone-matches</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:42:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 42, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46518.4" n="B" level="2"> (Sc. loca.) <hi rend="ital">Veins of sulphur</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 3, 28, § 49</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sulfureus: <entryFree id="n46519" type="main" key="sulfu^re^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sulfŭrĕus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sulph-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n46519.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">like sulphur</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sulphurous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sulphureous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fornaces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:340" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 340</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:517" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 517</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lux fulminum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 15, 50, § 177</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">color,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 6, 25, § 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 19, 34, § 141</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sulfurosus: <entryFree id="n46520" type="main" key="sulfu^ro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sulfŭrōsus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sulph-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n46520.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of sulphur</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sulphureous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fontes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 3 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plurima sulfurosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:7" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suliviae: <entryFree id="n46521" type="gloss" key="Su^li^vi^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sŭlĭvĭae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>a lengthened form for Silviae</etym>, <sense id="n46521.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of wood-goddesses</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2051</bibl>. — <cit><quote lang="la">Also in the form SVLEVIAE,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2099 sq.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
sulla: <entryFree id="n46522" type="main" key="Sulla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sulla</orth> (less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sylla</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n46522.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surname in the</hi> gens Cornelia. So, esp., </sense><sense id="n46522.1" n="I" level="1"> L. Cornelius Sulla Felix, <hi rend="ital">the celebrated Roman dictator</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:33:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 33, 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 100:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 100, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:21:5" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 21, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:17:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 17, 1</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sullānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Sulla</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:6:2:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 6, 2, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:26:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 26, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">assignationes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proscriptio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 2:34:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 2, 34, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saeculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 1:20:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 20, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 35, 59, § 123</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sullāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">partisans of Sulla</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:3:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 3, 2, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46522.2" n="II" level="1"> L. Cornelius Sulla Faustus, usually called Faustus Sulla, <hi rend="ital">a son of the dictator</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:34:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 34, 94</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 1, 4, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:3:7 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 3, 7 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n46522.3" n="III" level="1"> P. Cornelius Sulla, <hi rend="ital">a relation of the dictator</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accused of</hi> ambitus, <hi rend="ital">and defended<cb n="SUM" />  by Cicero in an oration still extant.</hi> —</sense><sense id="n46522.4" n="IV" level="1"> Publius and Servius Sulla, <hi rend="ital">conspirators with Catiline</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 17, 3</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 2, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46522.5" n="V" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An astrologer of the time of Caligula</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:57" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 57</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sullaturio: <entryFree id="n46523" type="main" key="sulla_tu^ri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sullātŭrĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <sense id="n46523.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. desid. n.</hi> [Sulla], <hi rend="ital">to imitate</hi> or <hi rend="ital">play the part of Sulla</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita sullaturit animus ejus et proscripturit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 10, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:32" default="NO">8, 6, 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sulmo: <entryFree id="n46524" type="main" key="Sulmo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sulmo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n46524.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town in the territory of the</hi> Peligni, <hi rend="ital">near</hi> Corfinium, <hi rend="ital">the birthplace of Ovid</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Sulmona</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquosus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:15:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 15, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gelidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:81" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 81</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:76" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:511" default="NO">8, 511</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:10:3" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 10, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 4, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 12</bibl>, A, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:21:28" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 21, 28</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n46524.1" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sulmōnensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Sulmo</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:250" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 26, 41, § 250</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sulmōnenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Sulmo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 18, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 12, 17, § 106</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sing. fem.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:187" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 187</bibl> —* </sense><sense id="n46524.2" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sul-montīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Sulmo</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">colonia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Colon. p. 145" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Colon. p. 145</bibl></cit> Goes.—</sense><sense id="n46524.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town of the</hi> Volsci <hi rend="ital">in</hi> Latium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:145" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 14, 41, § 145</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46524.4" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of a hero</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:412" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 412</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 517</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sulphur: <entryFree id="n46525" type="main" key="sulphur"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sulphur</orth>, and its derivv., v. sulfur.</entryFree>
sulpicilla: <entryFree id="n46526" type="main" key="Sulpi^cilla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sulpĭcilla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>Sulpicia</etym>, i. e. <sense id="n46526.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the poetess Sulpicia</hi>, Fulg. Myth. praef. 1 pr.; v. Sulpicius, VII.</sense></entryFree>
sulpicius: <entryFree id="n46527" type="main" key="Sulpi^ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sulpĭcĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>; <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sulpĭcĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n46527.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens; e. g. </sense><sense id="n46527.1" n="I" level="1"> Ser. Sulpicius Galba, <hi rend="ital">consul</hi> 610 A.U.C., <hi rend="ital">and an able orator</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:10:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 10, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:22:86" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 22, 86</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46527.2" n="II" level="1"> C. Sulpicius Gallus, <hi rend="ital">a connoisseur in Greek literature</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and a good orator</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:20:78" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 20, 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:6:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 6, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:27:101" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 27, 101</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46527.3" n="III" level="1"> Ser. Sulpicius Rufus, <hi rend="ital">a very celebrated jurist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a contemporary and correspondent of Cicero;</hi> v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 1</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:10:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 10, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:2:2:section=42 sq" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 2, 2, § 42 sq.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n46527.4" n="IV" level="1"> C. Sulpicius Apollinaris, <hi rend="ital">a grammarian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">teacher of the emperor Pertinax</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:16:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 16, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:17:11" default="NO">4, 17, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46527.5" n="V" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A tribune of the people. author of the</hi> lex Sulpicia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:18" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 18</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n46527.6" n="VI" level="1"> Sulpicia, <hi rend="ital">a Roman poetess in the time of Domitian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:35:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 35, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 9, 262</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n46527.7" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sulpĭcĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Sulpicius</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">horrea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:12:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 12, 18</bibl></cit>: lex, <hi rend="ital">proposed by the people</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s tribune</hi> P.Sulpicius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:21" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 21</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46527.8" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sul-pĭcĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Sulpicius</hi>: classis, <hi rend="ital">commanded by the prætor</hi> P. Sulpicius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 101</bibl>: seditio, <hi rend="ital">raised by</hi> P. Sulpicius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:75" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 75</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sultis: <entryFree id="n46528" type="main" key="sultis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sultis</orth> = si vultis, v. volo <sense id="n46528.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
sum: <entryFree id="n46529" type="main" key="sum1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sum</orth>, <itype>fŭi, esse</itype> (2d <sense id="n46529.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pers.</hi> ĕs, but usu. ēs in Plaut and Ter; old forms, <hi rend="ital">indic. pres.</hi> esum for sum, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=100" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 100</bibl> Müll.: essis for es, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 200, 30</bibl>, or Trag. Rel. p. 283 Rib.: simus for sumus, used by Augustus, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:87" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 87</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">fut.</hi> escit for erit, XII. Tab. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1:25" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 1, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">esit, XII. Tab. ap. Fest. s. v. nec, p. 162 Müll.: escunt for erunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:24:60:3:3:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 24, 60, 3, 3, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:619" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 619</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> fūvimus for fuimus, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:42:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 42, 168</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">FVVEIT, C. I. L. 1, 1051: fūit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 159</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fūerim,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 8, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fūerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 4, 1, 37</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">subj. pres.</hi> siem, sies, siet, etc., very freq., esp. in Plaut.; e. g. siem, Am. prol. 57; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 4, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 2, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 5, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">siet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 4, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 101</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sient,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 3, 16</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:47:157" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 47, 157</bibl>; also, <cit><quote lang="la">fuam, fuas, etc., regarded by G. Curtius, de Aorist. Lat. Rel. in Studien zur Gr. u. Lat. Gram. 1, 431 sqq., as an aorist: fuam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 2, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:6:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 6, 112</bibl>: fuas, Liv. Andron. ap. Non 111, 13; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 71</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 83</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 1, 1, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 1, 32</bibl>: fuat, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 111, 8</bibl>; Carm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 10</bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:639" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 639</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 108</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 110</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 5, 1, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 3, 12</bibl>: fuvisset, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:4:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 4, 4</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">part. pres.</hi> ens, used by Cæsar, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1140</bibl> P.; and by Sergius Flavius, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:33" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 33</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">fut. inf.</hi> fŏre for futurum esse, very freq., and so always with <hi rend="ital">partt.;</hi> cf. Madv. Gram. § 108; whence, <hi rend="ital">subj. imperf.</hi> forem fores, etc., for essem; esp. in conditional sentences and in the histt., but very rare in Cic.; v. Neue, Formenl. 2, 597 sqq.), <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>root es; Sanscr. as-mi, and the Greek <foreign lang="greek">es-mi,</foreign> whence <foreign lang="greek">ei\mi/;</foreign> <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> fui; root in Sanscr. bhū, to become; bhāvas, condition; Gr. <cb n="SUM" /> <foreign lang="greek">fu/w,</foreign> to beget; cf.: fetus, futuo, etc.</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to be</hi>, as a verb substantive or a copula. </sense><sense id="n46529.1" n="I" level="1"> As a verb substantive, <hi rend="ital">to be.</hi> </sense><sense id="n46529.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n46529.3" n="1" level="3"> Asserting existence, <hi rend="ital">to be</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">live</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">definitionum duo sunt genera prima: unum earum rerum quae sunt: alterum earum quae intelleguntur. Esse ea dico, quae cerni tangive possunt, ut fundum, aedes, parietem, cetera. Non esse rursus ea dico, quae tangi demonstrarive non possunt, cerni tamen animo atque intellegi possunt, ut si usucapionem, si tutelam, etc. ... definias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:5:26 sq" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 5, 26 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si abest, nullus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc illut est, quom me fuisse quam esse nimio mavelim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita paene nulla sibi fuit Phronesium ( = paene mortuus est),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne quod eloquimur sic, ut id aut esse dicamus aut non esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:38:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 38, 157</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non statim, quod esse manifestum est, etiam quid sit apparet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:81" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 81</bibl></cit>: est locus, Hesperiam quam mortales perhibebant, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 1</bibl> (Ann. v. 23 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">flumen est Arar, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo nequissimus omnium qui sunt, qui fuerunt, qui futuri sunt!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 21, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:15:section=43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 15, § 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quos inter societas aut est aut fuit aut futura est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:22:83" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 22, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec enim, dum ero, angar ullā re, cum omni vacem culpā: et, si non ero, sensu omnino carebo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si modo futuri sumus, erit mihi res opportuna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 11, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quando erit civitas, erit profecto nobis locus: sin autem non erit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:16:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 16, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nolite arbitrari, me cum a vobis discessero, nusquam aut nullum fore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:22:79" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 22, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si erit ulla res publica ... sin autem nulla erit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 16, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuimus Troes, fuit Ilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:325" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 325</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sive erimus seu nos fata fuisse volunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:5:32" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 5, 32</bibl></cit>: per quinquennia decem fuimus, Prud. Cath. praef. 2.—</sense><sense id="n46529.4" n="2" level="3"> Of events, <hi rend="ital">to be</hi>, <hi rend="ital">happen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occur</hi>, <hi rend="ital">befall</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take place</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa (solis defectio) quae fuit regnante Romulo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:16:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 16, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque enim est periculum, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 23, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amabo, quid tibi est?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 4, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid se futurum esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 27</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n46529.5" n="3" level="3"> Of location, <hi rend="ital">to be present</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be</hi> at a place. </sense><sense id="n46529.6" n="(a)" level="5"> With <pos>adv.</pos>, or other expressions of place: <cit><quote lang="la">cum non liceret quemquam Romae esse, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:41:section=100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 41, § 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Athenis decem ipsos dies fuissem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 8, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:7:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 7, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Africanus constituisset in hortis esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:9:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 9, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum essemus in castris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nonne mavis sine periculo tuae domi esse quam cum periculo alienae?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos istic commodissime sperem esse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: te hic tutissime puto fore, Pompon. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 11</bibl>, A.—</sense><sense id="n46529.7" n="(b)" level="5"> Of passages in a book or writing, with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case>, <hi rend="ital">to be</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be written</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">deinceps in lege est, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:16:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 16, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid enim in illis (litteris) fuit praeter querelam temporum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 16, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46529.8" n="(g)" level="5"> Of personal relations, with <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> or <hi rend="ital">apud</hi> and <case>acc.</case>, or <hi rend="ital">cum</hi> and <hi rend="ital">abl. of person</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum esset (Sulpicius Gallus) casu apud M. Marcellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:14:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 14, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eram cum Stoico Diodoto: qui cum habitavisset apud me mecumque vixisset, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:90:309" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 90, 309</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erat nemo, quīcum essem libentius quam tecum et pauci, quibuscum essem aeque libenter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 21, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui me admodum diligunt multumque mecum sunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 13, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. with <hi rend="ital">simul</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Smyrnae cum simul essemus complures dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:8:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 8, 13</bibl></cit>.—Hence, esp.: esse cum aliquo (aliquā), <hi rend="ital">to be with</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">live with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">associate with</hi>, as husband or wife: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus soror est cum P. Quintio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 24, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eā nocte mecum illa hospitis jussu fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:1:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 1, 1, 101</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:664" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 664</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum hac (meretrice) si qui adulescens forte fuerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:20:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 20, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:8:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 8, 27</bibl>: tum ad me fuerunt, qui, etc., Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 133, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Curio fuit ad me sane diu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ad me bene mane Dionysius fuit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 16, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">esse sub uno tecto atque ad eosdem Penates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46529.9" n="4" level="3"> Of relations analogous to place, of dress, condition, position, office, etc., <hi rend="ital">to be</hi>, <hi rend="ital">live</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be found</hi>, etc., with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum est in sagis civitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:11:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 8, 11, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in laxā togā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:3:78" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 3, 78</bibl></cit>: sive erit in Tyriis, Tyrios laudabis amictus; <cit><quote lang="la">Sive erit in Cois, Coa decere puta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:297" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 297</bibl></cit>: hominem non modo in aere alieno nullo, sed in suis nummis multis esse et semper fuisse, Cic. Verr <pb n="1798" /> <cb n="SUM" /> 2, 4, 6, § <cit><quote lang="la">11: in servitute,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Clu. 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in illā opinione populari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:51:142" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 51, 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in magno nomine et gloriā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 17, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in spe,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fam. 14, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tantā moestitiā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 15, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in odio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 22, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in probris, in laudibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 18, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in officio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:15:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 15, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in injustitiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:14:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 14, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in vitio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:19:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 19, 62</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 9, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne in morā quom opus sit, sies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne in morā illi sis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic in noxia'st,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 2, 1, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (civitas) una in amore atque in deliciis fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:1:section=3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 1, § 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ingenti periculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in pace,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 29</bibl></cit>.—So with <case>abl.</case> without <hi rend="ital">in</hi>, when qualified by an <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">(statua) est et fuit totā Graeciā summo propter ingenium honore et nomine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:35:section=87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 35, § 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis asperitate eā est et inmanitate naturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:23:87" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 23, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quo periculo proprio existimares esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 15, 2</bibl></cit> (B. and K. ex conj.: <cit><quote lang="la">in periculo): ego sum spe bonā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 28, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res nunc difficili loco mihi videtur esse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 28, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incredibili sum sollicitudine de tuā valetudine,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 15, 1</bibl></cit>; esp. in phrase periculo alicujus esse, <hi rend="ital">to be at the risk of</hi> any one: <cit><quote lang="la">rem illam suo periculo esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quae in naves inposuissent, ab hostium tempestatisque vi publico periculo essent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:49:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 49, 2</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">dare nummos meo periculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46:1:24" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 46, 1, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">communi periculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:6:21:section=1" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 13, 6, 21, § 1</bibl></cit> (cf. II. B. 1. <foreign lang="greek">b.</foreign> infra).— </sense><sense id="n46529.10" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To depend upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rest with</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">res erat non in opinione dubiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed totum est in eo, si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:22:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 22, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnem reliquam spem in impetu esse equitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:14:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 14, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam totum in eo sit, ne contrectentur pocula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:4:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 4, 3</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n46529.11" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n46529.12" n="1" level="3"> Esse (est, sunt, etc.) often stands without a <hi rend="ital">subject</hi> expressed, or with an <hi rend="ital">indef. subj.</hi>, as antecedent of a <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi>, whose verb may be in the <hi rend="ital">indic.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">subj.;</hi> the former only when the subject is conceived as particular or limited, and actually existing; the latter always when it is conceived as indefinite; cf. Zumpt, Gram. § 562 sq.; Roby, Gram. § 1686 sq.; Madv. Gram. § 365; but the distinctions usually drawn by grammarians are not always observed by the best writers; and the subjunctive is always admissible, being the prevailing construction after sunt qui in class. prose, and nearly universal in postAug. writers: sunt, qui (quae), <hi rend="ital">there are those</hi> (<hi rend="ital">people</hi> or <hi rend="ital">things</hi>) <hi rend="ital">who</hi> (<hi rend="ital">that</hi>), or simply <hi rend="ital">some.</hi> </sense><sense id="n46529.13" n="a" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">indic.</hi> </sense><sense id="n46529.14" n="(a)" level="5"> Without subject expressed: <cit><quote lang="la">mulier mane: sunt Qui volunt te conventam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt hic quos credo inter se dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:prol. 67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. prol. 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt quae te volumus percontari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid est, quod tu gestas tabellas?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid est, quod tu me nunc optuere?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 1, 69</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quid hoc est, quod foris concrepuit?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tun' is es, Qui in me aerumnam obsevisti?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:4:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 4, 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid est, quod tuo animo aegre est?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 2, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 4, 1, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">at ego est quod volo loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 3, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est quod te volo secreto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt quos scio amicos esse, sunt quos suspicor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita subitum'st, quod eum conventum volo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 2, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt quae ego ex te scitari volo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed est quod suscenset tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est quod me transire oportet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:2:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 2, 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid sit quapropter te jussi, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt item quae appellantur alces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 27 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(nationes) ex quibus sunt qui ovis vivere existimantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 10</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt qui putant posse te non decedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt autem, qui putant non numquam complexione oportere supersederi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:40:72" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 40, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamquam sunt, qui propter utilitatem modo petendas putant amicitias,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 55, 167</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt autem quae praeterii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt, qui abducunt a malis ad bona, ut Epicurus. Sunt, qui satis putant ostendere, nihil inopinati accidisse ... Sunt etiam qui haec omnia genera consolandi colligunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:31:76" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 31, 76</bibl></cit> Kühn. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt, qui, quod sentiunt, non audent dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:24:84" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 24, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Argiletum sunt qui scripserunt ab Argolā, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=157" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 157</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt qui ita dicunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 19:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 19, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt qui spiritum non recipiunt sed resorbent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:55" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt, quos curriculo pulverem Olympicum Collegisse juvat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 4, 24</bibl>: sunt quibus <cb n="SUM" /> unum opus est, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 7, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt quibus in satirā videor nimis acer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt quorum ingenium nova tantum crustula promit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 47</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46529.15" n="(b)" level="5"> With a subject expressed by an indefinite word or clause: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt alii qui te volturium vocant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est genus hominum qui se primos omnium esse volunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multae sunt causae, quam ob rem cupio abducere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 65</bibl></cit> Fleck. (Ussing, cupiam): <cit><quote lang="la">erat quidam eunuchus, quem mercatus fuerat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 5, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multaeque res sunt in quibus de suis commodis viri boni multa detrahunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:16:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 16, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt ejus aliquot orationes, ex quibus lenitas ejus perspici potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:48:177" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 48, 177</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuerunt alia genera philosophorum, qui se omnes Socraticos esse dicebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:17:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 17, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nonnulli sunt, qui aluerunt, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:12:301" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 12, 301</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt quidam, qui molestas amicitias faciunt, cum ipsi se contemni putant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:20:72" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 20, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt vestrum, judices, aliquam multi, qui L. Pisonem cognoverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:25:section=56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 25, § 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multae et pecudes et stirpes sunt, quae sine procuratione hominum salvae esse non possunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:52:130" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 52, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt bestiae quaedam, in quibus inest aliquid simile virtutis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:14:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 14, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">permulta sunt, quae dici possunt, quare intellegatur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:33:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 33, 94</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:7:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 7, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:14:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 14, 43</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 20, 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:54:123" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 54, 123</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuere complures, qui ad Catilinam initio profecti sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 39:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 39, 5</bibl></cit>: haec sunt, quae clamores et admirationes in bonis oratoribus efficiunt. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:33:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 33, 152</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alia fuere, quae illos magnos fecere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 52:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 52, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46529.16" n="b" level="4"> With. <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: sunt, qui discessum animi a corpore putent esse mortem; <cit><quote lang="la">sunt qui nullum censeant fieri discessum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:9:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 9, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt qui in rebus contrariis parum sibi constent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:21:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 21, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de impudentiā singulari sunt qui mirentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:2:section=6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 2, § 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est eisdem de rebus quod dici potest subtilius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:15:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 15, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesto est qui neget rem ullam percipi esse sensibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 32, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quicquid est quod deceat, id, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:27:94" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 27, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt qui nolint tetigisse nisi illas, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt qui Crustis et pomis viduas venentur avaras,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestes Gaetulo murice tinctas Sunt qui non habeant, est qui non curet habere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 182</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n46529.17" n="(b)" level="5"> With a more or less indefinite expression of the subject: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt quidam e nostris, qui haec subtilius velint tradere et negent satis esse, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rarum est quoddam genus eorum, qui se a corpore avocent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:49:111" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 49, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quotus igitur est quisque qui somniis pareat?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 60, 125</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:50:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 50, 196</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">solus est hic, qui numquam rationes ad aerarium referat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:38:section=98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 38, § 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae quibusdam admirabilia videntur, permulti sunt, qui pro nihilo putent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:23:86" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 23, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erat nemo in quem ea suspicio conveniret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:23:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 23, 65</bibl></cit>, cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quis enim miles fuit, qui Brundisii illam non viderit? quis, qui nescierit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:25:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 25, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sit aliquis, qui nihil mali habeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:35:85" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 35, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt nonnullae disciplinae, quae officium omne pervertant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est quaedam animi sanitas quae in insipientem quoque cadat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:13:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 13, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Syracusis lex est de religione, quae jubeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:51:section=126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 51, § 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unus est qui curet constantiā magis quam consilio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:18:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 18, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si est una ex omnibus quae sese moveat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:26:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 26, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multi sunt, qui non acerbum judicent vivere, sed supervacuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 24:26" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 24, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erant sententiae quae castra Vari oppugnanda censerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuere cives qui seque remque publicam obstinatis animis perditum irent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 36:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 36, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt verba et voces, quibus hunc lenire dolorem Possis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt delicta tamen, quibus ignovisse velimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:347" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 347</bibl></cit>.— * </sense><sense id="n46529.18" n="c" level="4"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: est, quibus (acc. to the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e)/stin oi(=s</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">est quibus Eleae concurrit palma quadrigae: est quibus in celeres gloria nata pedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:9" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 9</bibl></cit> (4, 8), 17.—</sense><sense id="n46529.19" n="2" level="3"> With <case>dat.</case>, <hi rend="ital">to belong</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertain to;</hi> or, rendering the dative as the subject of the verb, <hi rend="ital">to have</hi> (<hi rend="ital">possess</hi>, = the Fr. <hi rend="ital">ētre à</hi> used of property, and of permanent conditions or characteristics, not of temporary states, feelings, etc.; cf. Krebs, Antibarb. p. 417 sq.): aliquid reperiret, fingeret fallacias, Unde esset adulescenti, amicae quod daret, Ter. Heaut. <cb n="SUM" /> 3, 2, 23: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen Mercurio'st mihi, Plaut Am. prol. 19: nisi jam tum esset honos elo quentiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:10:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 10, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est igitur homini cum deo similitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:8:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 8, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">familiaritas, quae mihi cum eo est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:chapter=8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8</bibl></cit>. 3, 2: <cit><quote lang="la">privatus illis census erat brevis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:15:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 15, 13</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Trojae et huic loco nomen est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hecyra est huic nomen fabulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:prol. 1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. prol. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui saltationi Titius nomen esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:62:225" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 62, 225</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui (fonti) nomen Arethusa est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:53:section=118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 53, § 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Scipio, cui post Africano fuit cognomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 2, 6</bibl></cit>.—With ellips. of <case>dat.</case> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">nec rubor est emisse palam (sc. ei),</quote> <trans><tr>nor is she ashamed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A.
