R. 2</bibl></cit>, praef. § <cit><quote lang="la">7: aliquid summatim perscribere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 16, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid cognoscere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:28:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 10, 28, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summatim breviterque componere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:61" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summatim et uno tantummodo versiculo leviter attingit Vergilius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:2:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(animal) constitutionem suam crasse intellegit et summatim et obscure,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 121:12" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 121, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid attingere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:44" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëticam summatim attigit,</quote> <trans><tr>slightly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:85" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 85</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 61</bibl>: summatim aestimandum judici, an bonā fide imploretur judicium, Dig 5, 3, 7 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></sense></entryFree>
summatus: <entryFree id="n46546" type="hapax" key="summa_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">summātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n46546.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">chief rule</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supremacy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sovereignty</hi>, = principatus: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium ac summatum petere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1142</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
summe: <entryFree id="n46547" type="main" key="summe_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">summē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. superus <sense id="n46547.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
summedius: <entryFree id="n46548" type="hapax" key="summe^di^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sum-mĕdĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subm-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n46548.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">middle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mean</hi> positura, <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 432</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
summejo: <entryFree id="n46549" type="hapax" key="summe_jo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sum-mējo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subm-</orth>), <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46549.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make water under</hi> a thing, se, <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 8, 5 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
summejulus: <entryFree id="n46550" type="hapax" key="summe_ju^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">summējŭlus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subm-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>summejo</etym>, <sense id="n46550.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who makes water under himself</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who wets his bed</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 26 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
summergo: <entryFree id="n46551" type="main" key="summergo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sum-mergo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subm-</orth>), <itype>si, sum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46551.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to dip</hi> or <hi rend="ital">plunge under</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sink</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overwhelm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">submerge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">submerse.</hi> </sense><sense id="n46551.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.; most freq. <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">summersus equus voraginibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:33:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 33, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genera summersarum beluarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:39:100" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 39, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salgama semper jure summersa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:4:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: navis summersa, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum summersum in undā, Ov M. 12, 279: ipsos potuit summergere ponto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod (saxum) tumidis submersum tunditur olim Fluctibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquot procellis summersi paene sumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:8:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 8, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summersas obrue puppes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 5</bibl></cit>: omnes quondam terrae <pb n="1801" /> <cb n="SUMM" /> submersae profundo fuerunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:1:17" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 1, 17</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n46551.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (post-class. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">virtus summersa tenebris, Claud. lV. Cons. Hon. 221: publicatam summergere lectionem,</quote> <trans><tr>to suppress</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 104</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
summersio: <entryFree id="n46552" type="main" key="summersi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">summersĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subm-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>summergo</etym>, <sense id="n46552.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sinking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drowning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">submersion</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 182</bibl>; Firm. Math. 1, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
summerso: <entryFree id="n46553" type="main" key="summerso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">summerso</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n46553.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to plunge repeatedly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thoroughly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Rer. Gest. Alex. 3:26" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Rer. Gest. Alex. 3, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
summersus: <entryFree id="n46554" type="main" key="summersus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">summersus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subm-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of summergo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n46555" type="main" key="summersus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">summersus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subm-</orth>), <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>summergo</etym>, <sense id="n46555.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plunging under water</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sinking</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 32 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
summerus: <entryFree id="n46556" type="hapax" key="summe^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sum-mĕrus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subm-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n46556.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rather pure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:3:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 3, 116</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
summigratio: <entryFree id="n46557" type="main" key="summi_^gra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sum-mī^grātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subm-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n46557.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an emigration</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">e patriā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 25, 9, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
summinia: <entryFree id="n46558" type="hapax" key="summi^ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">summĭnĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subm-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sub-minium</etym>, <sense id="n46558.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of garment for women</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 50</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sumministratio: <entryFree id="n46559" type="main" key="summi^nistra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">summĭnistrātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subm-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sumministro</etym>, <sense id="n46559.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a giving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furnishing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supplying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subministration</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">divina incorruptibilitatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 48 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
sumministrator: <entryFree id="n46560" type="main" key="summi^nistra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">summĭnistrātor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subm-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n46560.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who aids</hi> or <hi rend="ital">assists;</hi> trop., <hi rend="ital">an abettor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">promoter</hi> (post- Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">libidinum testisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 114:23" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 114, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sumministratus: <entryFree id="n46561" type="hapax" key="summi^nistra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">summĭnistrātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subm-</orth>), <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n46561.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a furnishing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supplying</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exiguus cibi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 12, § 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sumministro: <entryFree id="n46562" type="main" key="summi^nistro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sum-mĭnistro</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subm-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46562.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to aid by giving; to give</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furnish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">afford</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supply</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n46562.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:9:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 9, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela clam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 9, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela ad manum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 7, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela agentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:3:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapides telaque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumentum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auxilia hostibus nostris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sauciis ac defatigatis integros equites, Auct. B. Afr. 78: puteus, qui CCC. pondo argenti Hannibali sumministravit in dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 6, 31, § 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquam radicibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pabulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:3:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabellarios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 13, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 14, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46562.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aristoteles huic arti plurima adjumenta atque ornamenta sumministravit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:5:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occasiones alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:61" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 104:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 104, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">materiam eloquentiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum animorum viriumque patriae et penatium conspectus sumministrat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:6:7:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 6, 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spem salutis licet tardam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
summisse: <entryFree id="n46563" type="main" key="summisse_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">summissē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. summitto, <sense id="n46563.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
summissim: <entryFree id="n46564" type="main" key="summissim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">summissim</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subm-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>summissus</etym>, <sense id="n46564.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in a low voice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">softly</hi> (post-Aug. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">fabulantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:74" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ridere (with sensim),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:8:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 8, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
summissio: <entryFree id="n46565" type="main" key="summissi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">summissĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subm-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>summitto</etym>, <sense id="n46565.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a letting down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lowering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dropping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sinking</hi> (Ciceron.): <cit><quote lang="la">ex contentione vocis et summissione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:41:146" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 41, 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(iterationes) erunt ab hac summissione orationis alienae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:25:85" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 25, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec elatio nec summissio,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>depression</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:18:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 18, 71</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
summissus: <entryFree id="n46566" type="main" key="summissus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">summissus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subm-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos> of summitto.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n46567" type="main" key="summissus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">summissus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subm-</orth>), <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>summitto</etym>, <sense id="n46567.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sending to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">introduction</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex summissu erroris ulciscitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 5, 16 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
summitas: <entryFree id="n46568" type="main" key="summi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">summĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>summus</etym>, <sense id="n46568.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the highest part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">height</hi>, <hi rend="ital">top</hi>, <hi rend="ital">summit</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">placidioribus locis septem pedibus summitas vitis insurgit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 6, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 6 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Censor.</author> de Die Nat. 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deum summitatem omnium summorum obtinentem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 2, p. 15, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 10, 6</bibl> (not <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 9, 37, § 118</bibl>, where Jan. reads imitata).</sense></entryFree>
summitto: <entryFree id="n46569" type="main" key="summitto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sum-mitto</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subm-</orth>), <itype>mīsi, missum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n46569.0" n="I" level="1"> With the force of <hi rend="ital">sub</hi> predominating (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post- Aug. prose; cf. subicio). </sense><sense id="n46569.1" n="1" level="3"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n46569.2" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To set</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">place under</hi> or <hi rend="ital">below</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">singuli agni binis nutricibus submittuntur: nec quicquam subtrahi submissis expedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:4:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vaccas tauris (for breeding),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Jul. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vaccas in feturam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equas alternis annis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Mart. 13, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canterium vitibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:14:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 14, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46569.3" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To send</hi> or <hi rend="ital">put forth below</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">from below</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cause to spring forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to send up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">produce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">raise</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tellus submittit flores,</quote> <trans><tr>puls forth</tr>, <tr>produces</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 8</bibl></cit>: fetus (tellus), id. <cb n="SUMM" /> 1, 193: <cit><quote lang="la">pabula pascendis equis (tellus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:411" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 411</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo colores (humus formosa),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:2:9" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 2, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <usg type="style">poet.</usg>: non monstrum summisere Colchi Majus, <hi rend="ital">did not produce</hi> (from the sowing of the dragon's teeth), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:4:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 4, 63</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">summissas tendunt alta ad Capitolia dextras,</quote> <trans><tr>upraised</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:640" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 640</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">palmas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:411" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 411</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oedip. 226" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oedip. 226</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">in a Gr. construction: summissi palmas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:673" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 673</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46569.4" n="2" level="3"> In partic., an econom. t. t., of animals or plants, <hi rend="ital">to bring up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">raise; to let grow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not kill</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cut off</hi> (cf. alo): <cit><quote lang="la">arictes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:2:18" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 2, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:2:3:4" default="NO">2, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:2:3:8" default="NO">2, 3, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tauros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pullos equorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitulos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 159</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:9:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 9, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:1:70" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 7, 1, 70</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">materiam vitis constituendae causā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 5:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> Arb. 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frutices in semen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:ib. 11:3:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 3, 36</bibl></cit>; 4, 31, 2; 4, 14, 3; <cit><quote lang="la">3, 10, 15: prata in faenum,</quote> <trans><tr>to let grow for hay</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 8, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:49:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 49, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:27" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 27</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n46569.5" n="3" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n46569.6" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To put in the place of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">substitute for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supersede</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">huic vos non summittetis? hunc diutius manere patiemini?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interim tamen, quamdiu summittantur et suppleantur capita quae demortua sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:1:70:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 7, 1, 70, § 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">necesse habebit alios fetus summittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:1:70" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 7, 1, 70</bibl></cit>, §§ 2 and 5.— </sense><sense id="n46569.7" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To cherish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">court</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetatem omnem in stipite conteres submittendo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 6, 13</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n46569.8" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To let down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lower</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sink</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drop</hi>, = demittere (class. and freq., esp. in the trop. sense). </sense><sense id="n46569.9" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ad pedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se patri ad genua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latus in herbā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput in herbā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:502" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 502</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">verticem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:638" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 638</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:340" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 340</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 1, 1, § 3</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">poplitem in terrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 191</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aures (opp. surrigere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 48, 67, § 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:372" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 372</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:36" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 36</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:79" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 79</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fasces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 30, 31, § 112</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:6:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 6, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">capillum,</quote> <trans><tr>to let grow</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:27:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 27, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Pol. 36:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Pol. 36, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">crinem barbamque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:67" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 47</bibl>.—Mid.: <cit><quote lang="la">Tiberis aestate summittitur,</quote> <trans><tr>sinks</tr>, <tr>falls</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 6, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46569.10" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to lower</hi>, <hi rend="ital">let down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make lower</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reduce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">moderate</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ii, qui superiores sunt, summittere se debent in amicitiā: sic quodammodo inferiores extollere,</quote> <trans><tr>condescend</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:20:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 20, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tributim summisi me et supplicavi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 10, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summittere se in humilitatem causam dicentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:52:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 52, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summittere se in privatum fastigium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:31:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 31, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut in actoribus Graecis fieri videmus, saepe illum, qui est secundarum aut tertiarum partium, cum possit aliquanto clarius dicere, quam ipse primarium, multum summittere, ut ille princeps quam maxime excellat,</quote> <trans><tr>to moderate his efforts</tr>, <tr>restrain himself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:15:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 15, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inceptum frustra submitte furorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:832" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 832</bibl></cit>: orationem tam summittere quam attollere decet, <hi rend="ital">to sink</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">speak in a plain style</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 13, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut illud lene aut ascendit ad fortiora aut ad tenuiora summittitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:67" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 67</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quando attollenda vel summittenda sit vox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:8:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(soni) cum intentione summittendā sunt temperandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 42</bibl></cit>: (praeceptorem) summittentem se ad mensuram discentis, <hi rend="ital">accommodating his instructions to the capacity</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:3:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 3, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad calamitates animos,</quote> <trans><tr>to submit</tr>, <tr>bow</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 25</bibl></cit>: animum periculo, Brut. et Cass. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 3, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos amori,</quote> <trans><tr>to surrender</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:414" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 414</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se temporibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. An. 4:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. An. 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba summittere,</quote> <trans><tr>to speak humbly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 11:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 11, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 17:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. Beat. 17, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui se,</quote> <trans><tr>to yield precedence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:2:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 13, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se culpae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to commit</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:4:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 4, 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furorem,</quote> <trans><tr>to put down</tr>, <tr>quell</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:832" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 832</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque enim pudor sed aemuli pretia submittunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 1, 8, § 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proinde ne submiseris te,</quote> <trans><tr>be not disheartened</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. Marc. 5:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. Marc. 5, 6</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimis videtur submisisse temporibus se Athenodorus,</quote> <trans><tr>yielded</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. An. 4:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. An. 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neutri fortunae se submittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 66:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 66, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum saevienti fortunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ei aliquis se submitteret,</quote> <trans><tr>accept his sovereignty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:2:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 13, 2, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n46569.11" n="II" level="1"> The signif. of the verb predominating, <hi rend="ital">to send</hi> or <hi rend="ital">despatch secretly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">provide secretly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">summittebat iste Timarchidem, qui moneret eos, si, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>secretly despatched</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:28:section=69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 28, § 69</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">iste ad pupillae matrem summittebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:41:section=105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 41, § 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summissis consularibus viris, qui peierarent,</quote> <trans><tr>suborned</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:28" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 28 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit> <cb n="SUMM" /> —</sense><sense id="n46569.12" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to send</hi>, <hi rend="ital">send off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">despatch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supply</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">summittit cohortes equitibus praesidio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subsidium alicui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 6</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">subsidium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 25</bibl></cit>; 4, 26; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">auxilium laborantibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 85</bibl></cit>: quoad exercitus huc summittatis, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:21:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 21, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:36" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi destinatum in animo esse, imperium alicui,</quote> <trans><tr>to transfer</tr>, <tr>resign</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 6, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinea summittit capreas non semper edules,</quote> <trans><tr>furnishes</tr>, <tr>supplies</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 43</bibl></cit>. —Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">summissus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subm-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (acc. to I. B.). </sense><sense id="n46569.13" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">let down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lowered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">low</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">scutis super capita densatis, stantibus primis, secundis submissioribus,</quote> <trans><tr>stooping lower</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 9, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caelicolae Summisso humiles intrarunt vertice postes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:638" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 638</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bracchia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:1:150" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 3, 1, 150</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:30:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 30, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">capillo summissiore,</quote> <trans><tr>hanging lower down</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:68" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">purpura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:159" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 159</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 54, § 145</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46569.14" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (class. and freq.). </sense><sense id="n46569.15" n="1" level="3"> Of the voice or of speech in gen., <hi rend="ital">low</hi>, <hi rend="ital">soft</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gentle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">calm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not vehement</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">lenis, suppressus): et contentā voce atrociter dicere et summissa leniter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:17:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 17, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox (with lenis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:63" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:90 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 90 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">murmur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:45" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio placida, summissa, lenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:43:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 43, 183</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 9</bibl>. —<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lenior atque summissior oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:64" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(sermo) miscens elata summissis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">actio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 4, 27</bibl></cit>. — <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of an orator: <cit><quote lang="la">forma summissi oratoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:26:90" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 26, 90</bibl></cit>; so (with humilis) <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 23, 76</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in prooemiis plerumque summissi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:138" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 138</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46569.16" n="2" level="3"> Of character or disposition. </sense><sense id="n46569.17" n="a" level="4"> In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">low</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mean</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grovelling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abject</hi> (syn. abjectus): <cit><quote lang="la">videndum est, ne quid humile, summissum, molle, effeminatum, fractum abjectumque faciamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:30:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 30, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivere neque summissum et abjectum, neque se efferentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:34:124" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 34, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 30</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n46569.18" n="b" level="4"> In a good sense, <hi rend="ital">humble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">submissive</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">humilis, supplex): submissi petimus terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causae reorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:154" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitates calamitate summissiores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:31:2" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 31, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">preces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:594" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 594</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">summissa precatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:476" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 476</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tristem viro summissus honorem Largitur vitae,</quote> <trans><tr>yielding</tr>, <tr>overcome</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:662" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 662</bibl></cit>.—The <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> seems not to occur.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">summissa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (acc. to I. A. 3. supra), <hi rend="ital">substitutes</hi> (sc. capita), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:1:70:section=5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 7, 1, 70, § 5</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n46569.19" n="2" level="3"> (Sc. verba.) <hi rend="ital">Calm passages</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quiet sayings</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">summissa, qualia in epilogis sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:137" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 137</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sum-missē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subm-</orth>). </sense><sense id="n46569.20" n="1" level="3"> Of speech, <hi rend="ital">softly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">calmly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not loudly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">harshly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:53:215" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 53, 215</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:55:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 55, 212</bibl> (opp. contentius): <cit><quote lang="la">sciscitari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 105 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> — </sense><sense id="n46569.21" n="2" level="3"> Of character, <hi rend="ital">calmly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quietly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">modestly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">humbly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">submissively</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui summisse supplicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scribere alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loqui (opp. aspere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:5:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agere (opp. minanter),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:582" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 582</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">summissius se gerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:26:90" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 26, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. Gild. 247</bibl></cit>.—No <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi></sense></entryFree>
summoenium: <entryFree id="n46570" type="main" key="Summoeni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Summoenĭum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Subm-</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>submoenia</etym>, <sense id="n46570.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place in Rome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">probably near the walls</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the resort of vile characters</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:35:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 35, 6</bibl>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Summoenĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Summœnium</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">uxores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:82:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 82, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">buccae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:61:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 61, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
summoleste: <entryFree id="n46571" type="main" key="summo^leste_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">summŏlestē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subm-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. summolestus.</entryFree>
summolestus: <entryFree id="n46572" type="main" key="summo^lestus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sum-mŏlestus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subm-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n46572.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat troublesome</hi> or <hi rend="ital">vexatious</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">illud est mihi submolestum, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 4, 4</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">summŏle-stē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">with some vexation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid ferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 21, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
summoneo: <entryFree id="n46573" type="main" key="summo^ne^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sum-mŏnĕo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subm-</orth>), <itype>ŭi, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n46573.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to remind privily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">give a hint</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">summonuit me Parmeno, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patres salutavit nominatim singulos, nullo summonente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:53" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 53</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
summonstro: <entryFree id="n46574" type="hapax" key="summonstro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sum-monstro</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subm-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46574.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to show privately</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">responsa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 143</bibl></cit> (al. subministrat).</sense></entryFree>
summopere: <entryFree id="n46575" type="main" key="summo^pe^re"><orth extent="full" lang="la">summŏpĕre</orth>, v. summus, under superus.</entryFree>
summorosus: <entryFree id="n46576" type="hapax" key="summo_ro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sum-mōrōsus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subm-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n46576.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat peerish</hi> or <hi rend="ital">morose</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">me illa valde movent stomachosa et quasi summorosa ridicula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:69:279" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 69, 279</bibl></cit>. <pb n="1802" /> <cb n="SUMO" /></sense></entryFree>
summotenus: <entryFree id="n46577" type="hapax" key="summo_te^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">summō-tĕnus</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n46577.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">up to the top</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">summotenus florescentibus floribus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 75</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
summotor: <entryFree id="n46578" type="hapax" key="summo_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">summōtor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subm-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>summoveo</etym>, <sense id="n46578.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who puts aside</hi> or <hi rend="ital">removes</hi> (in order to make room), <hi rend="ital">a clearer</hi> of a space: <cit><quote lang="la">summotor aditūs, praeco, accensus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the lictor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:29:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 29, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
summotus: <entryFree id="n46579" type="main" key="summo_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">summōtus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subm-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of summoveo.</entryFree>
summoveo: <entryFree id="n46580" type="main" key="summo^ve^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sum-mŏvĕo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subm-</orth>), <itype>mōvi, mōtum, 2</itype> (sync. form of the <sense id="n46580.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pluperf. subj.</hi> summosses, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 48</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to send</hi> or <hi rend="ital">drive off</hi> or <hi rend="ital">away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to remove</hi> (freq. and class.; cf.: repello, amolior). </sense><sense id="n46580.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n46580.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">hostes a portā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostes ex muro ac turribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostes ex agro Romano trans Anienem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:17:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 17, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostium lembos statione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 45, 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recusantes advocatos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 8, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam (Academiam) summovere non audeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:13:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 13, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summotā contione,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 7, 15</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">summoto populo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:38:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 38, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">submotis velut in aliam insulam hostibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 23</bibl></cit>: maris litora, <hi rend="ital">to remove</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extend</hi> (by moles), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:18:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 18, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">informes hiemes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 10, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regnum ipsum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:55:7" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 55, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">piratas mari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:6" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut legati juberentur, summoto eo (Caesare) milites alloqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:62:5" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 62, 5</bibl></cit>. —<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic spelunca fuit vasto submota reccssu (sc. ex oculis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 193</bibl></cit>.—Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi Alpes Germaniam ab Italiā summovent,</quote> <trans><tr>separate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 19, 23, § 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silva Phoebeos summovet ictus,</quote> <trans><tr>wards off</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:389" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 389</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46580.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n46580.4" n="1" level="3"> Of a lictor, <hi rend="ital">to clear away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remove</hi> people standing in the way, <hi rend="ital">to make room</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">i, lictor, summove turbam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:48:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 48, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:56:10" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 56, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:50:5" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 50, 5</bibl>; 25, 3, 16; <cit><quote lang="la">45, 7, 4: nemo submovebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:76:8" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 76, 8</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui summovetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 94:60" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 94, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sederunt in tribunali, lictor apparuit, summoto incesserunt,</quote> <trans><tr>after room had been made</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:27:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 27, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incedit (bos) submoto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 46, 71, § 185</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summoto aditus,</quote> <trans><tr>access after the lictors had made room</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:45:29:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 45, 29, 2</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.; 45, 7, 4; Inscr. Fratr. Arv. ap. Marin. 25; 32; 35.—</sense><sense id="n46580.5" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to remove</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dispel</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">non gazae neque consularis Summovet lictor miseros tumultus Mentis et curas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:16:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 16, 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">submove vitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 94:60" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 94, 60</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46580.6" n="2" level="3"> In econom. lang., <hi rend="ital">to clear off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sell off</hi> stock: <cit><quote lang="la">oves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:3:14" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agnos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:4:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 4, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46580.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to put</hi> or <hi rend="ital">keep away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to withdraw</hi>, <hi rend="ital">withhold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remove</hi> (syn. sepono): aliquem a re publicā, <hi rend="ital">from civil affairs</hi>, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:85" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 85</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem administratione reipublicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 16</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">reges a bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermonem a prooemio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:63" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnitudine poenae maleficio summoveri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:25:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 25, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summotus pudor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:11:18" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 11, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scrupulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:29:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 29, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summovendum est utrumque ambitionis genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:7:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hiemem tecto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:385" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 385</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46580.8" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">to banish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad Histrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:4:91" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 4, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:16:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 16, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem urbe et Italiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:45" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 45 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summotum defendis amicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:4:41" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 4, 41</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
summula: <entryFree id="n46581" type="main" key="summu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">summŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>summa</etym>, <sense id="n46581.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small sum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">summulas minutas distribuit servis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 77:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 77, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 271, 32</bibl>; Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef.</foreign> 2, 131.</sense></entryFree>
summultiplex: <entryFree id="n46582" type="main" key="summulti^plex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sum-multĭplex</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subm-</orth>), <itype>plĭcis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n46582.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">contained many times in another number</hi>, Boëth. <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> Arithm. 1, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
summurmuro: <entryFree id="n46583" type="main" key="summurmu^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sum-murmŭro</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subm-</orth>), <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46583.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to murmur a little</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in secrēt</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 6:9" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 6, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:8:11" default="NO">8, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
summus: <entryFree id="n46584" type="main" key="summus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">summus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, v. superus.</entryFree>
summussi: <entryFree id="n46585" type="main" key="summussi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">summussi</orth> = murmuratores (<sense id="n46585.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">murmurers</hi>). Naevius: odi, inquit, summussos; proinde aperte dice, quid sit, Fest. pp. 298 and 299 Müll. (Trag. Rel. p. 12 Rib.) [submusso].</sense></entryFree>
summuto: <entryFree id="n46586" type="hapax" key="summu_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sum-mūto</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subm-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46586.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to change</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interchange</hi>, <hi rend="ital">substitute</hi> one thing for another: hanc <foreign lang="greek">u(pallagh\n</foreign> rhetores, quia quasi summutantur verba pro verbis, <foreign lang="greek">metwnumi/an</foreign> grammatici vocant, quod nomina transferuntur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:27:93" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 27, 93</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sumo: <entryFree id="n46587" type="main" key="su_mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūmo</orth>, <itype>sumpsi, sumptum, 3</itype> (sync. form of the <sense id="n46587.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf. perf.</hi> sumpse, Naev. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:19:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 19, 6</bibl> (Com. Rel. v. 97 Rib.; <cit><quote lang="la">suremit for sumpsit, surempsit for sumpserit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Diac. 299, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:298:9" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> 298, 9</bibl>)), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>contr. for subimo, from sub-emo</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to take</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lay hold of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assume</hi> (syn. capio). </sense><sense id="n46587.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cb n="SUMO" /> auferere, non abibis, si ego fustem sumpsero, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 202</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">laciniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si hoc digitulis duobus sumebas primoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si mutuas non potero, certum'st sumam foenore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 3, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postremo a me argentum quanti est sumito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 9, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locum ( = capere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 6, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legem in manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unum quodque vas in manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:27:section=63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 27, § 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Epicurum et Metrodorum non fere praeter suos quisquam in manus sumit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:3:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationes in manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litteras ad te a M. Lepido consule quasi commendaticias sumpsimus,</quote> <trans><tr>have taken</tr>, <tr>provided ourselves with</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:26:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 26, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spatium ad vehicula comportanda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spatium ad colloquendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum ad aliquem interficiendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:11:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 11, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tusculi ante quam Romae sumpta sunt arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:19:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 19, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro conjuge ferrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 15</bibl></cit> (16), 371: <cit><quote lang="la">arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:71" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sume venenum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 5, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 10, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hann. 12, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">partem Falerni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:27:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 27, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cyathos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 8, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">panem perfusam aquā frigidā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:77" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potiunculam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antidotum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pomum de lance,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:5:20" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 5, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 111</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">soporem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion, 2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sumptā virili togā,</quote> <trans><tr>put on</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virilem togam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">94</bibl> <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:4:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 4, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">calceos et vestimenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:12:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 12, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regium ornatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 13, 3</bibl></cit>: latum clavum (opp. deponere bracas), Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:80" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 80</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">diadema,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:22" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annulos ferreos (opp. deponere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:100" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gausapa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:300" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 300</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alas pedibus virgamque manu tegumenque capillis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:672" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 1, 672</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perventum est eo, quo sumpta navis est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:23:89" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 23, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam mutuam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 20, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 24, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum mutuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:51" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 51</bibl></cit>.—Of time: <cit><quote lang="la">diem ad deliberandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus cibi quietisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46587.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n46587.3" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">calorem animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:288" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 288</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsequium animo, i. e. animo obsequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 10, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ariovistus tantos sibi spiritus, tantam arrogantiam sumpserat, ut, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>assumed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 33</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sumpsi animum,</quote> <trans><tr>I took courage</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:147" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos serpentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:545" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 3, 545</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vigorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:4:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 3, 4, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum spiritus plebs sumpsisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:54:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 54, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certamine animi adversus eum sumpto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exempla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:11:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 11, 38</bibl></cit>: sumptis inimicitiis, susceptā causā, etc., <hi rend="ital">taken upon one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assumed</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:11:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 11, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne bellum sumi facile, ceterum aegerrime desinere,</quote> <trans><tr>to be undertaken</tr>, <tr>entered upon</tr>, <tr>begun</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 83:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 83, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">bellum cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:42:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 42, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 2, 3</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n46587.4" n="2" level="3"> Esp.: supplicium sumere, <hi rend="ital">to exact satisfaction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inflict punishment</hi>, rarely <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">supplici sibi sumat, quod volt ipse, ob hanc injuriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:4:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 4, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis sumpsimus jam supplici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:2:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 5, 2, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">graviore sententiā pronuntiatā more majorum supplicium sumpsit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 44</bibl></cit>.—Usu. <hi rend="ital">de aliquo</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">potuisse hunc de illā supplicium sumere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:27:82" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 27, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum homo nefarius de homine nobili virgis supplicium crudelissime sumeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:37:section=91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 37, § 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supplicium de matre sumpsisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:24:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 24, 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 29</bibl>; cf. supplicium.—Rarely <hi rend="ital">ex aliquo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 3, 1</bibl>.— Post-class. also <hi rend="ital">ab aliquo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 1</bibl>, ext. 1; <cit><quote lang="la">5, 1, ext. 2.—Rarely poenam sumere ( = capere): pro maleficio poenam sumi oportere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:36:108" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 36, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">merentis poenas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:586" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 586</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poenam scelerato ex sanguine,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 949</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 501</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46587.5" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n46587.6" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To take</hi> (by choice), <hi rend="ital">to choose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">select</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">philosophiae studium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc sumo ( = suscipio), hoc mihi deposco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:12:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 12, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos Capuam sumpsimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 16, 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sumat aliquem ex populo monitorem officii sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 85, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">enitimini, ne ego meliores liberos sumpsisse videar quam genuisse,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to have adopted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sumite materiam vestris, qui scribitis, aequam Viribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis te mala sumere cogit? Aut quis deceptum ponere sumpta velit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:1:69 sq" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 1, 69 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">disceptatorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod tres patricios magistratus nobilitas sibi sumpsisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Miltiadem sibi imperatorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 1, 3</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem virum aut heroa lyrā vel acri Tibiā sumis celebrare, Clio?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: quis sibi res gestas Augusti scribere <cb n="SUMP" /> sumit? <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 3, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46587.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To take</hi> as one's own, <hi rend="ital">to assume</hi>, <hi rend="ital">claim</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arrogate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appropriate</hi> to one's self (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">ascisco, assumo, arrogo): quamquam mihi non sumo tantum neque arrogo, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed mihi non sumo, ut meum consilium valere debuerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 11</bibl></cit> D, § <cit><quote lang="la">6: sumpsi hoc mihi pro tuā in me observantiā, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:50:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 50, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum tibi sumito pro Capitone apud Caesarem, quantum, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 29, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi imperatorias partes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec sumit aut ponit secures Arbitrio popularis aurae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus modo sumit acerbos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:8:17" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 8, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mores antiquos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelio sumpta Thessalia est,</quote> <trans><tr>conquered</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2:43" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 2, 43</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46587.8" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To take</hi>, <hi rend="ital">get</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acquire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">receive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">distat sumasne pudenter an rapias,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudemque a crimine sumit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:474" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 474</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sumpto rigore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:139" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vel tua me Sestus vel te mea sumit Abydos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 17</bibl></cit> (18), 127. — </sense><sense id="n46587.9" n="D" level="2"> To take for some purpose, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to use</hi>, <hi rend="ital">apply</hi>, <hi rend="ital">employ</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consume</hi> (syn. insumo): <cit><quote lang="la">in malā uxore atque inimico si quid sumas, sumptus est: In bono hospite atque amico quaestus est, quod sumitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:79 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 79 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minus hercle in hisce rebus sumptum est sex minis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 9</bibl></cit> and 12: <cit><quote lang="la">frustra operam, opinor, sumo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 3, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frustra laborem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui rei opus est, ei hilarem hunc sumamus diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:3:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 3, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">videtis hos quasi sumptos dies ad labefactandam illius dignitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:16:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab.
