Post. 16, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sumpseris tibi familiaritatem nostram ad ornamentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 18, 2</bibl></cit>. —<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: curis sumptus, <hi rend="ital">consumed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">worn out</hi>, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:21:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 21, 42</bibl> (Trag. Fr. Inc. 8 Rib.).—</sense><sense id="n46587.10" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To undertake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">begin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enter upon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12:24" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 12, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellis ponendis sumendisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec maxime belli ratio sumendi fuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duellum cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:60" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 60</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hos expeditionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12:6" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 12, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non mandata expeditio, sed sumpta est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 12, 48</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">prima fide vocisque ratae temptamina sumpsit Liriope,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:341" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 341</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46587.11" n="F" level="1"> In an oration, disputation, etc. </sense><sense id="n46587.12" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To take for certain</hi> or <hi rend="ital">for granted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to assume</hi>, <hi rend="ital">maintain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suppose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affirm</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alterutrum fatearis enim sumasque necesse'st,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:974" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 974</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec solum ea sumitis ad concludendum, quae ab omnibus concedantur, sed ea sumitis, quibus concessis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:50:104" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 50, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid pro certo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>—With <hi rend="ital">inf.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">beatos esse deos sumpsisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:31:89" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 31, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro non dubio legati sumebant, quae Antiochi fuerunt, Eumenem aequius esse quam me habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:28:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 28, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46587.13" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To make</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take</hi> a beginning, etc. (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">ab uno signo sumamus exordium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab illā quaestione principium sumere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 2</bibl></cit>: quin fictio a capite sumat exordium, id. Opif. Dei, 12, 7.—</sense><sense id="n46587.14" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To take</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring forward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mention</hi> as a proof, an instance, etc. (cf. profero): <cit><quote lang="la">homines notos sumere odiosum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:16:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 16, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unum hoc sumo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 34, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sumam annum tertium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:44:section=104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 44, § 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex istis tuis sumam aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:15:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 15, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid quisquam potest ex omni memoriā sumere illustrius?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:12:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 12, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab oratore aut poëtā probato sumptum ponere exemplum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46587.15" n="G" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To take</hi> as a purchase, <hi rend="ital">to buy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purchase</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanti ego genus omnino signorum non aestimo, tanti ista quattuor aut quinque sumpsisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 23, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decumas agri Leontini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:64:section=149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 64, § 149</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae parvo sumi nequeunt, obsonia captas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 106</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46587.16" n="H" level="1"> Aliquam, <hi rend="ital">to use</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enjoy</hi>, etc., in mal. part., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:81:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 81, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mille licet sumant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 90</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 5</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">gaudia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Nemes.</author> Ecl. 4, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 100</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46587.17" n="K" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To take</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fascinate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">charm</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">simul conspexerit juvenem, venustate ejus sumitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 116, 40</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sumpsio: <entryFree id="n46588" type="main" key="sumpsi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sumpsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, v. sumptio.</entryFree>
sumptifacio: <entryFree id="n46589" type="hapax" key="sumpti^fa^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sumptĭ-făcĭo</orth>, <itype>fēci, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>2. sumptus</etym>, <sense id="n46589.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to lay out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expend</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">restim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 7, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sumptio: <entryFree id="n46590" type="main" key="sumptio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sumptio</orth> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">sumpsio</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 145, 2</bibl>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sumo</etym>, <sense id="n46590.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a taking.</hi> </sense><sense id="n46590.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 2, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46590.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, in logic, <hi rend="ital">a premise taken for granted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an assumption</hi>: demus tibi istas duas sumptiones, ea quae <foreign lang="greek">lh/mmata</foreign> appellant dialectici; <cit><quote lang="la">sed nos Latine loqui malumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:53:108" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 53, 108</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sumptito: <entryFree id="n46591" type="hapax" key="sumpti^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sumptĭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n46591.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to</hi> <pb n="1803" /> <cb n="SUNI" /> <hi rend="ital">take much of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in strong doses</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepius helleborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 5, 21, § 51</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sumptuarius: <entryFree id="n46592" type="main" key="sumptu^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sumptŭārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. sumptus</etym>, <sense id="n46592.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relating to expense</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sumptuary</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationes nostrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:47:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 47, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 7, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 26, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:24" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sumptuatus: <entryFree id="n46593" type="main" key="sumptu^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sumptŭātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, <sense id="n46593.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">well furnished</hi> (late Lat.); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Rer. Gest. Alex. M. 2:18" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Rer. Gest. Alex. M. 2, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sumptuose: <entryFree id="n46594" type="main" key="sumptu^o_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sumptŭōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. sumptuosus <sense id="n46594.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
sumptuositas: <entryFree id="n46595" type="hapax" key="sumptu^o_si^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sumptŭōsĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sumptuosus</etym>, <sense id="n46595.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">great expense</hi>, <hi rend="ital">costliness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expensiveness</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sumptuosus: <entryFree id="n46596" type="main" key="sumptu^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sumptŭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. sumptus</etym>, <sense id="n46596.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very expensive</hi> or <hi rend="ital">costly.</hi> </sense><sense id="n46596.1" n="I" level="1"> Of things, <hi rend="ital">that costs much</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expensive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sumptuous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:23:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 23, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tutela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:17:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 17, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dignitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 2:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">substructiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludi sumptuosiores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 8, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cicercula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:3:22" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 3, 22</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">portum operis sumptuosissimi fecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n46596.2" n="II" level="1"> Of persons, <hi rend="ital">spending much</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lavish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wasteful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extravagant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:4:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 4, 2, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:7:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 4, 7, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:4:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:31:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 31, 135</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:6:3:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 6, 3, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:48" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in libidines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:50" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ego sumptuosus sum, sed urbs ipsa magnas impensas exigit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 50:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 50, 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sumptŭōsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">expensively</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sumptuously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">convivia lauta sumptuose facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:47:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 47, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:17:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 17, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se sumptuosius jactare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 9, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equos et canes emere sumptuosius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 39</bibl></cit> (48), 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sumptus: <entryFree id="n46597" type="main" key="sumptus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sumptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of sumo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n46598" type="main" key="sumptus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sumptus</orth>,, <itype>ūs</itype> (<sense id="n46598.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> sumpti, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 22, 3</bibl>; Lucil., Turp., Caecil., and Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 484, 30 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0146,001:ib. 132:16" default="NO"><author>Turp.</author> ib. 132, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 1, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 7, 2</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>sumo, II. D.</etym>, <hi rend="ital">expense</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cost</hi>, <hi rend="ital">charge</hi> (class.; used alike in <number>sing.</number> and <number>plur.</number>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">impendium): at tibi tanto sumptui esse mihi molestum'st,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quor tu his rebus sumptum suggeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 1, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 3, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 3, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine sumptu tuo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:8:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 5, 8, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perpetuos sumptus suppeditare, nec solum necessarios, sed etiam liberales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:12:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 12, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud te rogo, sumptu ne parcas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 16, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extra modum sumptu et magnificentiā prodire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:39:140" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 39, 140</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sumptus epularum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:34:97" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 34, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid sumptūs in eam rem aut laboris insumpserit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:38:113" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 38, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad incertum casum et eventum certus quotannis labor et certus sumptus impenditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:98:section=227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 98, § 227</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sumptum in rem militarem facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:30:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 30, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnino nullus in imperio meo sumptus factus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulli sumptūs, nulla jactura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:16:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 16, 38</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 21, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adventus noster nemini ne minimo quidem fuit sumptui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sumptum nusquam melius posse poni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:2:section=3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 2, § 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exiguus sumptus aedilitatis fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:17:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 17, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestores sumptum, quem oportebat dari, non dederunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:29:87" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 29, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si qui suo sumptu functus esset officio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnum numerum equitatūs suo sumptu alere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">publico sumptu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:38:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 38, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppida publico Sumptu decorare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:15:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 15, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quom tolerare hujus sumptus non queat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 2, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi videbit tantos sibi sumptus domi Cottidianos fieri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 4, 5</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">5, 1, 57: unde in eos sumptus pecunia erogaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:20:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 20, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in his immanibus jacturis infinitisque sumptibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:16:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 16, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minuendi sunt sumptus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:23:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 23, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sumptus, quos in cultum praetorum socii facere soliti erant, circumcisi aut sublati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:27:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 27, 4</bibl></cit>: servi qui opere rustico Faciundo facile sumptum exercerent suum, <hi rend="ital">could pay their expenses</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the cost of keeping them</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 91</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non amplius in singulas cenas sumptus esse facturos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:24:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 24, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cenarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:24:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 24, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:24:15" default="NO">2, 24, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sumtifacio: <entryFree id="n46599" type="main" key="sumti^fa^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sumtĭfăcĭo</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sumtĭo</orth>, etc., v. sumpt-.</entryFree>
sunamitis: <entryFree id="n46600" type="main" key="Sunami_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sunamītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n46600.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Shunamite</hi>: puella, Hier Ep. 52, 2.</sense></entryFree>
sunium: <entryFree id="n46601" type="main" key="Su_ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sūnĭum</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sūnĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*sou/nion,</foreign> <sense id="n46601.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a promontory and town of Attica</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Capo Colonna</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:2:8" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:6" default="NO">2, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 10, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 3, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 7, 11, § 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 5, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 3, 3, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:22" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 22</bibl>; <cb n="SUPE" /> 32, 17.—Form Sunion, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:563" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 563</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:625" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 625</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sunuci: <entryFree id="n46602" type="main" key="Sunuci"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sunuci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n46602.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Belgic people</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 17, 31, § 106</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suo: <entryFree id="n46603" type="main" key="su^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭo</orth>, <itype>sŭi, sūtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. siv-, sivjāmi, sew; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">kassu/w,</foreign> to stitch, cobble</etym>, <sense id="n46603.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to sew</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stitch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sew</hi>, <hi rend="ital">join</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">tack together</hi> (rare but class.). </sense><sense id="n46603.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod (foramen) nisi permagnā vi sui non potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tegumenta corporum vel texta vel suta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:60:150" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 60, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unius os sutum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12:36" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 12, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pellibus et sutis arcent male frigora bracis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:10:19" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 10, 19</bibl></cit>: hi plerasque naves loris suebant, Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:3:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 3, 4</bibl>: navis suta lino et sparteis serilibus, Pac. ap. Fest. s. v. serilla, p. 340 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> Müll. (Trag. Rel. v. 251 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">corticibus suta cavatis alvearia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pilea suta de caesis lacernis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:9:24" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 9, 24</bibl></cit>. — * </sense><sense id="n46603.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">metue lenonem, ne quid suo suat capiti,</quote> <trans><tr>devise</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 3, 2, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. consuo, II. — <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sūta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">that which is made of plates fastened together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a coat of mail</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic gladio perque aerea suta Per tunicam squalentem auro latus haurit apertum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:313" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 313</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnorum aerea suta Thoracum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:585" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 585</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latus omne sub armis Ferrea suta terunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 131</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suomet: <entryFree id="n46604" type="main" key="su^o_met"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭōmet</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭopte</orth>, v. suus.</entryFree>
suovetaurilia: <entryFree id="n46605" type="main" key="su^o^ve^tauri_li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭŏvĕtaurīlĭa</orth>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">sōlĭtaurīlĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>sus-ovis-taurus; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:67" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 67</bibl> Spald.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=293" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 293</bibl> Müll., or sollus-taurus</etym>, <sense id="n46605.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sacrifice consisting of a swine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sheep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and a bull</hi>, offered esp. at lustrations: <cit><quote lang="la">solitaurilia hostiarum trium diversi generis immolationem significant, tauri, arietis, verris, quod omnes eae solidi integrique sint corporis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=293" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 293</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mars pater lustri faciendi ergo macte hisce suovetaurilibus lactentibus esto, an old formula of prayer,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 141, 3 sq.</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 144, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:10" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:44:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 44, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:10:14" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 10, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 53</bibl>; Fest. s. v. opima, p. 189 Müll.; Inscr. Fr. Arv. ap. Marin. 32; 41; 43.—Form solitaurilia, Ps.-Ascon. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:chapter=3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 3</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=293" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 293</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
supellecticarius: <entryFree id="n46606" type="hapax" key="su^pellecti^ca_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpellectĭcārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>supellex</etym>, <sense id="n46606.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relating to household stuff</hi> or <hi rend="ital">furniture</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">servi,</quote> <trans><tr>that have the care of it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:12:section=31" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 7, 12, § 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
supellex: <entryFree id="n46607" type="main" key="su^pellex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpellex</orth> (<case>nom.</case> supellectilis, <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 3, 23</bibl>; Salv. Gub. Dei, 3, 2), lectĭlis (<case>abl.</case> -li or -le; v. Neue, Formenl. 1, 240), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>superlego</etym>, <sense id="n46607.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">household utensils</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stuff</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furniture</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">goods</hi> (class.; only in <number>sing.</number>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vasa, utensilia, instrumenta),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 10</bibl></cit> (De supellectile legata), 1; 33, 10, 3; 33, 10, 7; Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 782</bibl> P.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:22:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 22, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 5, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 8, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:3:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 3, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:34:section=83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 34, § 83</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 17, § 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:13:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 13, 32</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 15, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:1:2:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 1, 2, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 8, 37; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 118</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:2:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 2, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:14" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad ornanda colla,</quote> <trans><tr>ornaments</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,026:5:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jud. 5, 30</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi> supellectiles (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 8, 42</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which, class.: plurima Deliaca supellex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:72:section=176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 72, § 176</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46607.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">apparatus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furniture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">outfit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">qualification</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicos parare, optimam et pulcherrimam vitae, ut ita dicam, supellectilem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:15:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 15, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usus oratoriae quasi supellectilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:24:80" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 24, 80</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in oratoris instrumento tam lauta supellex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:36:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 36, 165</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui occupatus est in supervacuā litterarum supellectile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 88:36" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 88, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 95:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 95, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">copiosa verborum supellex,</quote> <trans><tr>stock</tr>, <tr>store</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8</bibl></cit>, prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">28: tecum habita, et noris, quam sit tibi curta supellex,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>what an ill-furnished mind you have</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:4:52" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 4, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scientiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 1 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
super: <entryFree id="n46608" type="main" key="su^per1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper</orth>, <pos>adj.</pos>, v. superus.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n46609" type="main" key="su^per2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> and <pos>prep.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. upari; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">u(pe/r;</foreign> Goth. ufar</etym>, <sense id="n46609.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">above</hi>, <hi rend="ital">over</hi> (often confounded in MSS. and edd. with supra, q. v.). </sense><sense id="n46609.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">above</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on top</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thereupon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">upon</hi>, etc. (rare but class.). </sense><sense id="n46609.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of place: <cit><quote lang="la">Anien infraque superque Saxeus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:3:20" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 3, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo super tigna bipedalia, iniciunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec super e vallo prospectant Troes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 168</bibl></cit>: implenturque super puppes, <hi rend="ital">from above</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">by rain</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 697</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">purpureas super vestes ... Coniciunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 221</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 217</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">renes tunicis super conteguntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imponendum super medicamentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 19 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n46609.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n46609.4" n="1" level="3"> Of <cb n="SUPE" /> that which is over and above in number or quantity, <hi rend="ital">over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">moreover</hi>, <hi rend="ital">besides</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis superque esse sibi suarum cuique rerum,</quote> <trans><tr>enough and to spare</tr>, <tr>more than enough</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:13:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 13, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis superque prudentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:9:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Har. Resp. 9, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra Epicurum satis superque dictum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut satis superque vixisse videamur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:45:110" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 45, 110</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:1:31" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 1, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidque furor valeat, satisque Ac super ostendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:430" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 430</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poenas dedit usque superque Quam satis est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 65</bibl></cit>: cui neque apud Danaos usquam locus; <cit><quote lang="la">et super ipsi Dardanidae infensi, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>and moreover</tr>, <tr>and besides</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saevit amor ferri ... Ira super,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 462</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">super talis effundit pectore voces,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 482</bibl></cit>; 11, 670: voto deus aequoris alti Annuerat; <cit><quote lang="la">dederatque super, ne saucius ullis Vulneribus fieri posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 206</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 751</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 308</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 78</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:24:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 24, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">annum agens aetatis sexagensimum ac nonum, superque mensem ac diem septimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 24</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">gen. part.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non operae est satis superque oneris sustinenti res a populo Romano gestas scribere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:25:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 25, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primoribus, super quam quod dissenserant a consilio, territis etiam duplici prodigio,</quote> <trans><tr>besides that</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 3, 14</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">super quam quod,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:20:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 20, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46609.5" n="2" level="3"> Less freq. of that which is left over, <hi rend="ital">over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">left</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remaining</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Atheniensibus exhaustis praeter arma et naves nihil erat super,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 8, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nec spes ulla super,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8:435" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 8, 435</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid super sanguinis, qui dari pro republicā possit? rogitantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:58:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 58, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">super tibi erunt, qui dicere laudes tuas cupiant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o mihi sola mei super Astyanactis imago,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:489" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 489</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n46609.6" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Prep.</hi> with <case>acc.</case> and <case>abl.</case>, <hi rend="ital">over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">above</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the top of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on.</hi> </sense><sense id="n46609.7" n="A" level="2"> With <case>acc.</case> </sense><sense id="n46609.8" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of place or situation: <cit><quote lang="la">super terrae tumulum noluit quid statui, nisi columellam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:26:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 26, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">super lateres coria inducuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 10</bibl>, § <cit><quote lang="la">4: super quas (naves) turrim ad introitum opposuit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 39</bibl></cit> Dinter (al. quā): <cit><quote lang="la">super vallum praecipitari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 58:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 58, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum alii super aliorum capita ruerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:39:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 39, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">super caput hostium pervenire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:11:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 11, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua super montium juga concreta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:58:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 58, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domos super se ipsos concremaverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 14, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cenaculum super aedes datum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad senaculum ac super id curiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:27:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 41, 27, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equi super eum ruentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:49:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 49, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">super eam (aspidem) assidere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:18:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 18, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">super theatrum consistere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:39:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 39, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquila super carpentum volitans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:34:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 34, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa super terram defecto poplite labens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:477" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 477</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">collis erat, collemque super planissima Area,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:86" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut scopulum super duram illidat corticem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clatri super aquam emineant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:17:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 17, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">super arcem pensiles horti sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:1:32" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestis super genua est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:6:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">super pulpitum consulares conlocare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:54" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 54</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46609.9" n="b" level="4"> Of position or distance, <hi rend="ital">above</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beyond</hi>: Nomentanus erat super ipsum, Porcius infra, <hi rend="ital">was above him</hi> (at table), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Polypercon, qui cubabat super regem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:5:22" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 5, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">super se collocavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 43</bibl></cit>.—Of geographical situation: <cit><quote lang="la">super Numidiam Gaetulos accepimus,</quote> <trans><tr>beyond Numidia</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 19:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 19, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">super et Garamantas et Indos Proferet imperium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:795" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 795</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">super Sunium navigans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 8, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sita est super Ambracium sinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:21:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 43, 21, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">super Demetriadem promunturium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:46:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 46, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:21:6" default="NO" valid="yes">43, 21, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui super Bosporum colunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:2:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 2, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:6:12" default="NO">7, 6, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:1:7" default="NO">8, 1, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lydia super Ioniam procedit,</quote> <trans><tr>extends beyond</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 29, 30, § 110</bibl></cit>.—Of official position ( = supra): <cit><quote lang="la">super armamentarium positus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:7:22" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 7, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 162" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 162</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n46609.10" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n46609.11" n="a" level="4"> Of time, <hi rend="ital">during</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at</hi> (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">de hujus nequitiā omnes super cenam loquebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:22:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 22, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 5, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:33:1" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 33, 1</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">super vinum et epulas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:4:30" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 4, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:12:17" default="NO">8, 12, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:77" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:87" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 87</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">super mensam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:4:7" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">super hos divum honores,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>during the sacrifice</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:676" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 676</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2:69" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 2, 69</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46609.12" n="b" level="4"> Of that which is over and above a certain number or quantity, <hi rend="ital">over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">above</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beyond</hi>, <hi rend="ital">upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">besides</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in addition to</hi> (not freq. till after the Aug. period): <cit><quote lang="la">quod alii super alios legati venirent speculaturi,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>in rapid succession</tr>, <tr>constantly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:25:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 25, 8</bibl></cit>: vox non paene tragoedorum sed super omnes tragoedos, <pb n="1804" /> <cb n="SUPE" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:5:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 5, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">super modum ac paene naturam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:169" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">super necessitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 3, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">famosissima super ceteras fuit cena ei data adventicia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">super veteres amicos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 55</bibl></cit>.—With numerals: <cit><quote lang="la">super tris modios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">super LX. milia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">super octingentos annos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 13, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">super quadraginta reos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:38" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">super HS. millies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">senioribus super sexaginta annos in Epirum missis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:25:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 25, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">super triginta ducibus triumphos decernendos curavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:38" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Punicum exercitum super morbum etiam fames affecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:46:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 46, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">super tam evidentem tristis ominis eventum, etiam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:18:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 41, 18, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">super dotem haec tibi dona accedent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:50:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 50, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:51:2" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 51, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">super solitos honores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:31:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 31, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">super vota fluere,</quote> <trans><tr>beyond all wishes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">super obscena dicta et petulans jurgium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dare savia super savia,</quote> <trans><tr>kisses upon kisses</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 1, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alii super alios trucidentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:50:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 50, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnus super vulnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:54:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 54, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut habitationes super pretium libertatis praestarentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:6:19" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 18, 6, 19</bibl></cit>.—Esp. freq.: super omnia, <hi rend="ital">above all</hi>, <hi rend="ital">before all</hi> (in Plin. the elder, super omnia and super omnes always at the beginning of the phrase; v. Sillig ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 19, § 62</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">talia carminibus celebrant: super omnia Caci Speluncam adiciunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:303" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 303</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetas et forma et super omnia Romanum nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 18, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 15, 24, § 118</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:9:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 9, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:526" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 526</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 677</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">tu super omnes beatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 13, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:5:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 5, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46609.13" n="c" level="4"> Hence, transf., in gen., for plus quam, amplius quam, <hi rend="ital">more than</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">qui amat filium aut filiam super me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:10:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 10, 37</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dulciora sunt super mel et favum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:18:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Psa. 18, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46609.14" n="B" level="2"> With <case>abl.</case> </sense><sense id="n46609.15" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of place or situation (rare and mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">regulae, quae lateres, qui super musculo struantur, contineant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ensis cui super Cervice pendet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ligna super foco Large reponens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 9, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parumne campis atque Neptuno super Fusum est Latini sanguinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:7:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">super Pindo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:12:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 12, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">requiescere Fronde super viridi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 81</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n46609.16" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n46609.17" n="a" level="4"> Of time (cf. supra, A. 2. a.), <hi rend="ital">during</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nocte super mediā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 61</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Centaurea cum Lapithis rixa super mero Debellata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:18:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 18, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46609.18" n="b" level="4"> For the usual <hi rend="ital">de</hi>, to indicate respect, reference, <hi rend="ital">upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">concerning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">respecting</hi> (freq. in the ante-class. and after the Aug. period; in Cic. only a few times in his letters; not in Cæs.): nemo antea fecit super tali re cum hoc magistratu utique rem, Cato ap. Fest. s. v. superescit, p. 305 Müll.; so Pac. ib.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 3, 2, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hac super re scribam ad te Rhegio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed hac super re nimis (sc. dixi),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 8, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litteras super tantā re exspectare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:15:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 15, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cura super tali re principum laudata est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:46:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 46, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multus eā super re rumor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid nuntias super anu?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 4, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">super Euclionis filia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 4, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">super ancillā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 3, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">super amicā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 133</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 6, 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 2, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid agendum nobis sit super legatione votivā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 22, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">super tali causā missi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legare super familia pecuniave sua,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 13, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">super tali causā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa super Priamo rogitans, super Hectore multa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:750" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 750</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 233</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">super arvorum cultu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:559" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 559</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mitte civiles super Urbe curas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:8:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 8, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">publicus ludus super impetrato Augusti reditu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 2, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decreta super jugandis Feminis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,002:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> C. S. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consultant bello super,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:271" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 271</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:615" default="NO">5, 615</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne super tali scelere suspectum sese haberet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 71:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 71, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">super adimendā vitā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 7, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46609.19" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Over and above</hi>, <hi rend="ital">besides</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beyond</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">modus agri ... hortus ... fons ... Et paulum silvae super his,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">excogitatum est super his, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 1, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:60" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 60</bibl>.?*! In composition, super denotes, </sense><sense id="n46609.20" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Above</hi>, <hi rend="ital">over</hi>, of place: supercerno, supercresco, superdo, superemineo, superemorior, superferc, superfluo, superfugio, superfundo, supergredior, superjacio, superimpono, superincumbo, superinduco, supernato, superpono, supersedeo, supersterno, supersto, supervehor, supervenio, etc.—</sense><sense id="n46609.21" n="2" level="3"> Less freq., <hi rend="ital">over and above</hi>, <hi rend="ital">besides</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in addition</hi>: superaddo,<cb n="SUPE" />  superbibo, supersum, superstes, superfio.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n46672" type="main" key="su^per3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-dūco</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (postclass.), <sense id="n46672.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to lead</hi> or <hi rend="ital">draw over</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pampinum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 5, 17 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: novercam tot liberis, <hi rend="ital">to bring</hi> or <hi rend="ital">put over</hi>, Capitol. M. Aur. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">novercam filio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 38" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 38</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46672.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To add</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subjoin</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 36</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cor. Mil. 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n46676" type="main" key="su^pe^r4"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpĕr-efflŭo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n46676.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to superabound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be superfluous</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Psa. 118</bibl>, Serm. 14, § <cit><quote lang="la">9: mensura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:6:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 6, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quicquid,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 35, 511</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">PECVNIA,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 1772, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46676.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To be abundantly exalted above</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">legi supereffluit doctrina Christi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Luc. 5, 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n46677" type="main" key="su^pe^r5"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpĕr-effulgĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n46677.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be more than effulgent</hi> (late Lat.), Rustic. c. Aceph. p. 1250.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n46682" type="main" key="su^pe^r6"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpĕr-ēmĭnĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n46682.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to overtop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to appear</hi> or <hi rend="ital">be above</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to rise above</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n46682.1" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">victor viros supereminet omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:857" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 857</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umero undas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 765</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluctus omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:2:49" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 2, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quas omnes aspis supereminens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 15, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46682.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut olivae premantur et jus superemineat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:49:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 49, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 5:15:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 5, 15, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">herba paulum supereminens extra aquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 8, 33, § 50</bibl></cit> (al. semper eminens).—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpĕrēmĭnens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">rising above</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prominent; comp.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Cont. Virg. p. 146</bibl>. —<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, Aug. Spir. et <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> 65.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n46693" type="hapax" key="su^pe^r7"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpĕr-excellens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n46693.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very excellent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">superexcellent</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Salv.</author> adv. Avar. 3, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n46697" type="main" key="su^pe^r8"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpĕr-exsulto</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n46697.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to leap up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exult greatly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 5:92" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 5, 92</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Complex. ad Ep. Jacob. 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n46701" type="hapax" key="su^per9"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-fēto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n46701.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to conceive anew while still with young</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to superfetate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 63, 83, § 179</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:48" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 11, 9, § 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:219" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 55, 81, § 219</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n46708" type="main" key="su^per10"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-fīo</orth>, <itype>fĭĕri</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n46708.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be over and above</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be left</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to remain</hi> (very rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): edepol te vocem (ad cenam) libenter, si superfiat locus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 2, 10</bibl></cit>; <cb n="SUPE" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 4, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 4, 2, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 108</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae superfieri possunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:1:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 1, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n46713" type="main" key="su^per11" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-flŭo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n46713.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n46713.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to run over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overflow</hi> (mostly postAug.; only once in Cic.; syn. redundo). </sense><sense id="n46713.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aeneo vase leniter coquuntur, ne superfluant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 18, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fons superfluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 4, 28, § 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superfluentis Nili receptacula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si (Nilus) immodicus superfluxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 6:7:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 6, 7, 3</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n46713.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n46713.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To be superabundant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to superabound</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecunia non superfluens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:11:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 1, 11, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 1:3:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Contr. 1, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ad Helv. 6:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ad Helv. 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">claritas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 7, 11, § 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46713.5" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to be superfluous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil neque desit, neque superfluat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 2, 22</bibl></cit>; so (opp. deesse) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 10, 16</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 7, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 15, 24, § 115</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46713.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To have a superabundance</hi> of a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Venetis Aquileia superfluit armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:606" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 606</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">redundantes nos et superfluentes juvenili quādam dicendi impunitate et licentiā, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:91:316" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 91, 316</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">orator non satis pressus sed supra modum exsultans et superfluens,</quote> <trans><tr>extravagant</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 18</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">superbus et superfluens (sc. divitiis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:29:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 29, 7</bibl></cit>.— * </sense><sense id="n46713.7" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to flow by</hi> or <hi rend="ital">past</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec quae dicentur, superfluent aures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 5, 13</bibl></cit> Spald.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n46726" type="main" key="su^per12"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-gestus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [gero]. * <sense id="n46726.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Carried</hi> or <hi rend="ital">heaped upon</hi> or <hi rend="ital">over</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 6</bibl></cit>. — * </sense><sense id="n46726.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Covered over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">covered up</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">orificium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 237</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n46730" type="main" key="su^per13"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-grĕdĭor</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpergrădĭor</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 12, 68, § 110</bibl>), gressus, 3, <sense id="n46730.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>gradior</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to step</hi>, <hi rend="ital">walk</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">go over</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n46730.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">limen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:9:13" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 9, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 10, 46, § 133</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">capram alteram decubuisse atque ita alteram proculcatae supergressam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 50, 76, § 201</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46730.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to pass over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">get over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surmount; to surpass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exceed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetatis suae feminas pulchritudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnem laudem supergressa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6</bibl></cit>, prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">8: claritatem parentum animi magnitudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:2:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 42, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus res gestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 44, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crudele praeceptum, supergressum omnia diritatis exempla,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 28, 1, 25</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n46730.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To live through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">survive</hi> a period of time: <cit><quote lang="la">sexagin ta annos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Suas. 6:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Suas. 6, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46730.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To be superior to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elevated above</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">necessitates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 32:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 32, 5</bibl></cit>.?*! * </sense><sense id="n46730.5" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpergrĕ-dĭo</orth>, <itype>dĕre</itype>, <hi rend="ital">to go over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pass</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">duodecimum aetatis annum supergresserat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 238, 34</bibl></cit> (dub.).— * </sense><sense id="n46730.6" n="b" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpergressus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> signif., <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Nov. 4, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n46739" type="main" key="su^per14"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-immĭnĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n46739.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to hang over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overhang</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">pastorem Ense sequens nudo superimminet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:306" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 306</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrā superimminente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 5:15:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 5, 15, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgineusque pudor zonae superimminet artus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Arat. 962</bibl></cit>: mons superimminens, Hilar, in Psa. 124, 3.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n46741" type="hapax" key="su^per15"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-impendens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [impendeo], <sense id="n46741.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">overhanging</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">silvae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:287" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 287</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
supera: <entryFree id="n46610" type="main" key="su^pe^ra_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpĕrā</orth>, <sense id="n46610.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">supra</ref></xr> <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
