C. 1, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventosum aequor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:591" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 591</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluvium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oet. 128" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oet. 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedibus salsas lacunas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1031" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 1031</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munitiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 8, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quas (Alpes) nullā dum viā superatas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:34:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 34, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:26:4" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 26, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:30:5" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 30, 5</bibl>; 21, 38, 1; <cit><quote lang="la">23, 45, 3: Tauro monte superato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 13, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">montes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:270" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 270</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alpes cursu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 183</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immensa montium juga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:81:1" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 81, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caucasum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:3:22" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 3, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc jugum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:676" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 676</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fossas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 314</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summi fastigia tecti Ascensu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 303</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">caprae gravido superant vix ubere limen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:317" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 317</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">retia saltu (vulpes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:767" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 767</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum itineris,</quote> <trans><tr>to traverse</tr>, <tr>pass over</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 33</bibl></cit>: regionem castrorum, <hi rend="ital">to go past</hi> or <hi rend="ital">beyond</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 69</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:19:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 19, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">insidias circa ipsum iter locatas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:50:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 50, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">collocatur in eo turris tabulatorum quae superaret fontis fastigium,</quote> <trans><tr>but so as to overtop</tr>, <tr>command</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:41" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superat (Parnassus) cacumine nubes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:317" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 317</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46824.10" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n46824.11" n="a" level="4"> Naut. t. t., <hi rend="ital">to sail by</hi> or <hi rend="ital">past</hi> a place, a promontory, etc.; <hi rend="ital">to double</hi> or <hi rend="ital">weather</hi> a point, etc.; promontorium, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 1, 244</bibl>; Auct. B. Afr. 62, 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 26, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:25:6" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 25, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:23:3" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 23, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 46</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">Euboeam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursu Isthmon,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:11:5" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 11, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intima Regna Liburnorum et fontem Timavi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:244" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 244</bibl></cit> Serv.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, transf.: musarum scopulos, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:19:76" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 19, 76</bibl> (Ann. v. 223 Vahl.).— </sense><sense id="n46824.12" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To rise above</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exceed</hi> in height: <cit><quote lang="la">ut alibi umbilico tenus aqua esset, alibi genua vix superaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:45:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 45, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: posterior partes superat mensura priores, i. e. <hi rend="ital">exceeds</hi> in size, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:378" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 378</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46824.13" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to surpass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exceed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">outdo</hi>, <hi rend="ital">outstrip</hi> in any quality, in value, etc. </sense><sense id="n46824.14" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">non potest quaestus consistere, si eum sumptus superat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne sumptus fructum superet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:53" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui omnes homines supero atque antideo cruciabilitatibus animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtute, laude, dignitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:2:6 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 2, 6 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut ingenio aut fortunā aut dignitate superari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:3:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes homines constantiā et gravitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">doctrinā Graecia nos et omni litterarum genere superabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctoritatis pondere et utilitatis ubertate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:44:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 44, 195</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8</bibl>, prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">4: aliquem nobilitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:2:56" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 2, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phoebum superare canendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes scelere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem dignitate vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ingenio, id. Dion, 4, 1: duritiā ferrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:2:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 2, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vel cursu superare canem vel viribus aprum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes in ceteris artibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summam spem civium incredibili virtute,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:3:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non dubitabam, quin hanc epistulam multi nuntii, fama denique esset ipsa tua celeritate superatura,</quote> <trans><tr>will outstrip</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n46824.15" n="2" level="3"> In partic., in milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">to overcome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subdue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conquer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vanquish</hi> (syn. debello): <cit><quote lang="la">victis hostibus, quos nemo posse superari ratu'st,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">armatos ac victores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maximas nationes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 28</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 24: quos integros superavissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bello superatos esse Arvernos et Rutenos a Q. Fabio Maximo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 1, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si Helvetios superaverint Romani,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Massilienses bis proelio navali superati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clam ferro incautum superat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:350" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 350</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bello superatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:364" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 364</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Asiam bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tota insula in unā urbe superata est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:6" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46824.16" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen.: quem (C. Curium) nemo ferro potuit superare nec auro, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:3:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 3, 6</bibl> (Ann. v. 220 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">in quo (genere officii) etiam si multi mecum contendent, omnes facile superabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si erum videt superare amorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc (orationem) assidua ac diligens scriptura superabit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:33:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 33, 150</bibl></cit>: si meam spem <cb n="SUPE" /> vis improborum fefellerit atque superaverit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:11:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 11, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">injurias fortunae facile veterum philosophorum praeceptis superabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:7:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pareatur necessitati, quam ne dii quidem superant,</quote> <trans><tr>which even the gods are not above</tr>, <tr>not superior to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">casus omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:244" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 244</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superanda omnis fortuna ferendo est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 710</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 368</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">difficultates omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:120:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 120, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum incedendi nimietate jam superarer,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 19, 8, 6</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpĕrans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> * </sense><sense id="n46824.17" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Rising high</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prominent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">high</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lofty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mons superantissimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 2 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>—* </sense><sense id="n46824.18" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Prevailing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">predominant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">superantior ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:394" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 394</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
